audio_item.dc.title: Sound Recording - Mott Foundation Program - 1952 October 19
audio_item.dc.contributor.author: Cushing, George

audio_item.dc.description: Content note: The sound recording(s) associated with this repository item derive from a single audio reel tape. A single tape may yield multiple audio files if there were variations in tape stock, speed, or channels (i.e. stereo or mono). For more information see http://deepblue.lib.umich.edu/handle/2027.42/108126.
audio_item.dc.abstract: [Side 1] : [Part 1] : In Our Opinion radio program discussing Flint School System, featuring guests: Mr. C.S. Mott (Leading Citizen and Supporter of Community School Idea), Mr. Frank Manley (Director of Mott Foundation), Mrs. Elizabeth Smith (Principal of Freeman School), Bill Minardo (Director of School Activities), Mr. and Mrs. Jim Gleason, Mr. and Mrs. Jack Hudson, Miss Ola Miller, Harold Bacon, Mary Nell Walker, Judy Anderson, Becky Feleski, Stephanie Rose, Mr. and Mrs. Don Steibel, Mr. and Mrs. Douglas Jenkins, Jim Rush, Helen Beacon, Ron Gamble, Dale McIntyre). Includes a discussion of the use of a school auditorium for community activities.
